snippet: The former speaker of the House became more active in his lobbying firm at about the time that, according to a federal indictment, he began making large payments to a man known as “Individual A.”
abstract: Documents and emails show former House Speaker J Dennis Hastert became much busier with his consulting and lobbying firm in 2010, traveling worldwide to meet with clients, at about same time, according to federal indictment, he made his first payment to man known as 'Individual A' toward total of $3.5 million; indictment charges Hastert with violating federal bank laws regarding large cash withdrawals.

byline.contributor: Ashley Southall contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The former speaker of the House became more active in his lobbying firm at about the time that, according to a federal indictment, he began making large payments to a man known as “Individual A.”

headline.main: Dennis Hastert Rushed to Make Money as Payouts Grew
headline.print_headline: Hastert Rushed to Earn Money Amid Payouts
